title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 1850.11 - Procedure at Conferences in Contested Matters
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 1850.11 - Procedure at Conferences in Contested Matters

State Regulations
ORDERED, that subject to this court's Alternate Dispute

Resolution rules, all contested matters shall be placed on this court's early
settlement conference calendar and a settlement conference shall be scheduled, and it is further
ORDERED, that matters not fully resolved after
mediation, if required, shall be placed on this court's reserve trial and
hearing calendar and a pre-trial conference shall be scheduled, and it is
further
ORDERED, that when directed by the court, pursuant to

Uniform Rule 207.29, a detailed schedule for an exchange of bills of
particulars, of all pre-trial discovery procedures, and a firm trial date shall
be set forth in a pre-trial stipulation to be executed by the attorneys in
attendance or parties, if unrepresented, and "So Ordered" by the court, and it
is further
ORDERED, that any modification of the same can only be
made upon leave of the court, and in the event that there has been
noncompliance with the order, a conference shall be scheduled to determine the
reason for said noncompliance. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22
ยง
1850.11

Amended

New

York State Register May 17, 2023/Volume XLV, Issue 20, eff. 5/17/2023

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
